SEARCH
Package gw.api.modules.rest.framework.v1.resources

Class RestCollectionResource

java.lang.Object
gw.api.modules.rest.framework.v1.resources.RestResource
gw.api.modules.rest.framework.v1.resources.RestCollectionResource
Direct Known Subclasses:
RestDualCollectionResource, RestQueryCollectionResource, RestStreamCollectionResource
public abstract class RestCollectionResource extends RestResource
Base class for all collection resources. A collection resource is a resource that contains element resources. A collection is typically either backed by a database query (see RestQueryCollectionResource) or an arbitrary stream of values (see RestStreamCollectionResource). A collection resource should not directly extend this class, but one of those (or a subclass thereof) instead.

    • buildElementResource

      public RestElementResource buildElementResource(Object element)
      Builds a child element resource from the passed in element. This method should be overridden if the child resource type doesn't have an init method that takes a single element argument.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to use during resource creation.
      Returns:
      A newly constructed child element resource.

      public abstract com.guidewire.pl.modules.rest.framework.v1.query.paging.PaginatedList<? extends RestElementResource> loadPaginatedList(String includePrefix) throws Exception
      Does the actual work of loading a PaginatedList of child RestElementResources
      Parameters:
      includePrefix - the prefix to pass through to the sorting, paging, and filtering code in cases where the RestCollectionResource is being loaded as an included resource
      Returns:
      the PaginatedList that wraps the collection of elements
      Throws:
      Exception

    • getCanCreateException

      public RestRequestException getCanCreateException()
      This method can be overridden to handle cases where the user is permitted to create children of this resource, but children cannot be created for some other reason related to the object's state. Return null to indicate that the children can be created provided the caller has permission, and return a RestRequestException to indicate that children cannot be created for some other reason.

    • createMinimalChild

      public RestElementResource createMinimalChild(DataEnvelope data)
      This method is invoked during resource creation to create a new RestElementResource as a child of this resource, using the minimum possible amount of information from the request. The rest of the fields will be filled in by calling applyPatchForCreate and finishCreate directly on the child resource. Keeping the initial resource creation minimal helps to avoid ordering constraints when several related resources need to be created as part of the same request for the sake of batch updates.
      Parameters:
      data - the DataEnvelope that contains the data for the element that should be created
      Returns:
      the newly-created RestElementResource that is a logical child of this resource

    • validateRequiredFields

      protected void validateRequiredFields(DataAttributes attributes)
      This method is invoked during resource creation to ensure any fields necessary for createMinimalChildElement(DataAttributes) are present. This default implementation constructs and throws a properly formatted RestRequestException if any fields are missing.

      Note: Generally subclasses should favor overriding getRequiredFields(DataAttributes) if possible, and only override this method if more complex conditional required field validation is required.

      Parameters:
      attributes - the DataAttributes containing field values to validate.

    • getRequiredFields

      public List<String> getRequiredFields(DataAttributes attributes)
      Overridden by subclasses if some attributes are required in order to create a minimal child.
      Parameters:
      attributes - the attributes, in case the list of required fields depends on the json data.
      Returns:
      A list of strings denoting which of the attributes are required for child creation.

    • createMinimalChildElement

      public Object createMinimalChildElement(DataAttributes attributes)
      This method is invoked during resource creation to create a new child element (usually an empty entity) that can be used to construct a new child resource in a call to buildElementResource().
      Parameters:
      attributes - the DataAttributes containing any fields for the element to create
      Returns:
      the newly-created Element that can be used to construct a logical child of this resource
      See Also:
      • createMinimalChild(DataEnvelope)

    • canPerformAction

      public final boolean canPerformAction(String method, String customAction)
      Description copied from class: RestResource
      Indicates whether or not the specified HTTP method and custom action can be invoked by the currently-authorized user on this resource. This method is used to determine what links should be generated on responses.
      Specified by:
      canPerformAction in class RestResource
      Parameters:
      method - the HTTP method in all lower-case, such as "get" or "post"
      customAction - the custom action, if any, such as "assign" or "complete"
      Returns:
      true if the currently authenticated user can invoke the given method and action, false if not

    • getFilters

      public final Map<String,? extends FilterField> getFilters(ApiConfiguration config)
      Returns the valid filter fields for this resource, represented as a map whose keys are the filter option names (the first part of a ?filter query parameter value) and values are the corresponding FilterField objects, which contain the filtering logic.
      Parameters:
      config - the ApiConfiguration to inspect for schema information
      Returns:
      map of filter option names to FilterFields

    • getAllDefinedFilters

      public final Map<String,? extends FilterField> getAllDefinedFilters(ApiConfiguration config)
      Returns the valid and invalid filter fields for this resource, represented as a map whose keys are the filter option names (the first part of a ?filter query parameter value) and values are the corresponding FilterField objects, which contain the filtering logic.
      Parameters:
      config - the ApiConfiguration to inspect for schema information
      Returns:
      map of filter option names to FilterFields

    • getSchemaFilters

      protected Map<String,? extends FilterField> getSchemaFilters(ApiConfiguration config)
      Returns the filter options declared on this collection's child resource's schema. A schema-defined option exists for every property on this collection's child resource's schema definition that has the extension property "filterable: true" and can be converted into a FilterField (see @link convertToFilter(String, ApiConfiguration)). Properties that are declared filterable but for which no FilterField could be constructed are added as InvalidFilterFields (they will ultimately not be considered valid filter options). This is not considered an error because multiple resources may reference the same schema, and a schema property may be determined to be filterable for one such resource but not the others. Later, these InvalidFilterFields will be handled by the FilterParameterParser. This method is not intended to be overridden, except to explicitly exclude filter options that would otherwise be automatically determined from the schema.
      Returns:
      map of schema-defined filter options

    • getCustomFilters

      public Map<String,? extends FilterField> getCustomFilters(ApiConfiguration config)
      Returns a map of filter option names to FilterFields. Override this method to add more sophisticated filter options that cannot be simply declared on the schema.
      Parameters:
      config -
      Returns:
      map of custom filter options

    • convertToFilter

      protected FilterField convertToFilter(String propertyName, ApiConfiguration config)
      Given a schema property name, returns the FilterField object describing how filtering should be performed. Typically, filtering logic depends on the path to which the property is mapped; the config argument is used to find the appropriate mapper definition. Returns null if no FilterField could be created.
      Parameters:
      propertyName - the schema property by which to filter this collection
      config - the ApiConfiguration in which to look for a mapping property
      Returns:
      the FilterField

    • getDefaultFilters

      public List<String> getDefaultFilters()

    • getSortColumnMap

      public Map<String,? extends SortField> getSortColumnMap()
      Returns the valid sort options for this resource. This works the same as getSortColumnMap(ApiConfiguration), using the current operation context's configuration. This method is not intended to be overridden, except to narrow the covariant return type.
      Returns:
      map of sort option names to SortFields

    • getExpandedSortColumnMap

      public Map<String,? extends SortField> getExpandedSortColumnMap()
      Returns all defined sort options for this resource, valid and invalid. This works the same as getExpandedSortColumnMap(ApiConfiguration), using the current operation context's configuration. This method is not intended to be overridden, except to narrow the covariant return type.
      Returns:
      map of sort option names to SortFields

    • getSortColumnMap

      public final Map<String,? extends SortField> getSortColumnMap(ApiConfiguration config)
      Returns the valid sort options for this resource, represented as a map whose keys are the sort option names (the first part of a ?sort query parameter value) and values are the corresponding SortField objects, which contain the sorting logic. The valid sort options can either be schema-defined or resource-defined. Schema-defined options are those declared on this collection's child resource's schema definition (see getSchemaSortColumnMap(ApiConfiguration). The config argument is used to find the appropriate schema definition. Resource-defined sort options are those implemented in the collection resource's getCustomSortColumnMap(ApiConfiguration)). If a schema-defined option and resource-defined option have the same name, the resource-defined option takes precedence in the resulting map.
      Parameters:
      config - the ApiConfiguration to inspect for schema information
      Returns:
      map of sort option names to SortFields

    • getExpandedSortColumnMap

      public final Map<String,? extends SortField> getExpandedSortColumnMap(ApiConfiguration config)
      Returns both the valid and invalid sort options for this resource, represented as a map whose keys are the sort option names (the first part of a ?sort query parameter value) and values are the corresponding SortField objects, which contain the sorting logic. The sort options can either be schema-defined or resource-defined. Schema-defined options are those declared on this collection's child resource's schema definition (see getSchemaSortColumnMap(ApiConfiguration). The config argument is used to find the appropriate schema definition. Resource-defined sort options are those implemented in the collection resource's getCustomSortColumnMap(ApiConfiguration)). If a schema-defined option and resource-defined option have the same name, the resource-defined option takes precedence in the resulting map.
      Parameters:
      config - the ApiConfiguration to inspect for schema information
      Returns:
      map of sort option names to SortFields

    • getSchemaSortColumnMap

      protected Map<String,? extends SortField> getSchemaSortColumnMap(ApiConfiguration config)
      Returns the sort options declared on this collection's child resource's schema. A schema-defined option exists for every property on this collection's child resource's schema definition that has the extension property "sortable: true" and can be converted into a SortField (see @link convertToSortField(String, ApiConfiguration)). Properties that are declared sortable but for which no SortField could be constructed are added as InvalidSortFields (they will ultimately not be considered valid sort options). This is not considered an error because multiple resources may reference the same schema, and a schema property may be determined to be sortable for one such resource but not the others. Later, these InvalidSortFields will be handled by the SortParameterParser This method is not intended to be overridden, except to explicitly exclude sort options that would otherwise be automatically determined from the schema.
      Returns:
      map of schema-defined sort options

    • getCustomSortColumnMap

      public Map<String,? extends SortField> getCustomSortColumnMap(ApiConfiguration config)
      Returns a map of sort option names to SortFields. Override this method to add more sophisticated sort options that cannot be simply declared on the schema.
      Parameters:
      config -
      Returns:
      map of custom sort options

    • convertToSortField

      protected SortField convertToSortField(String propertyName, ApiConfiguration config)
      Given a schema property name, returns the SortField object describing how sorting should be performed. Typically, sorting logic depends on the path to which the property is mapped; the config argument is used to find the appropriate mapper definition. Returns null if no SortField could be created.
      Parameters:
